bioghist.p: Raymond Vanderlinde is Emeritus Professor of Pathology and Laboratory Medicine at Hahnemann University of Philadelphia. Prior to working at Hahnemann, Vanderlinde was a chemist with the State of New York Department of Health Division of Laboratories and Research. He is a member of the American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC), Upstate New York and Philadelphia divisions, and served as a member of the Board of Directors of AACC from 1979 to 1981, and was a member of various AACC committees. Dr. Vanderlinde is the author or co-author of more than 80 publications, principally in the areas of enzyme measurement and standardization, enzyme reference materials, laboratory evaluation, and quality control. AACC is an international scientific/medical society of clinical laboratory professionals, physicians, research scientists and other individuals involved with clinical chemistry and clinical laboratory science disciplines. Founded in 1948, the society has 9,500 members and is headquartered in Washington, DC. AACC is subdivided geographically into 22 local sections.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of Vanderlinde's work for the NY State Department of Health and of his work on various AACC committees. The collection includes: Vanderlinde's master's and doctoral theses from Syracuse University; a scrapbook of letters to Vanderlinde; records from Vanderlinde's time as a chemist at the State of New York Department of Health Division of Laboratories and Research; legal documents about the College of American Pathologists (CAP) consent decree; grant applications; articles by Vanderlinde and others on screening procedures, along with supporting research materials (articles, brochures) and correspondence; slides on drugs of abuse; reprints; reference manuals for equipment and clinical practices; documents about quality control and proficiency testing; AACC bylaws, section membership lists, histories, newsletters, programs for and correspondence about meetings of the Upstate NY and Philadelphia sections of AACC and committees thereof.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
